etymology.description: Depicts a curved line with a dot, symbolizing speech or words
etymology.interpretation: 讠(訁) (yán, "speech") is the simplified radical for words or speech. As a pictogram, it represents the essential concept of communication.

examples.chinese: 汉字中的讠构件(漢字中的言構件)，常出现在有关话语的字中(常出現在有關話語的字中)。
examples.pinyin: Hànzì zhōng de yán gòujiàn, cháng chūxiàn zài yǒuguān huàyǔ de zì zhōng.
examples.english: The 讠 component in Chinese characters often appears in characters related to speech.

examples.chinese: 古人重视讠之力量(古人重視言之力量)，认为言传身教胜过万言(認為言傳身教勝過萬言)。
examples.pinyin: Gǔrén zhòngshì yán zhī lìliàng, rènwéi yán chuán shēnjiào shèngguò wànyán.
examples.english: Ancient people valued the power of speech, believing that teaching by example was superior to a thousand words.

examples.chinese: 含讠字形的汉字(含言字形的漢字)，通常与言语表达密切相关(通常與言語表達密切相關)。
examples.pinyin: Hán yán zìxíng de hànzì, tōngcháng yǔ yányǔ biǎodá mìqiè xiāngguān.
examples.english: Chinese characters with the 讠 radical are usually closely associated with speech expression.
